channel.title: Help With Muting
channel.description:
Hello! I have successfully added music and sound effects to my server! I was wondering how I could add a mute button. I have downloaded a 317 deob, with 377 cache, with some edits (models, etc...). I am using a 317 game frame and I want to make a mute button. In Webber's client, you can view the id. So when I 'mouse' over the off button I get the id 930. I hope that makes sense... here's a picture.
[IMG]http://img29.imageshack.us/img29/6062/id930.png[/img]
Now I have tried some ways to try to at least enable it. Like here's my code:
[code] case 930: sendMsg("Stop no clipping!"); break;[/code] I put that just to see if I click on 930, it would say to 'Stop No Clipping'. When I restarted (and compiled :D) and I clicked on the off button, it did nothing again.
Now my question is, is there any way to mute the volume either by command or client button , or anything else?
I am using RichScape Source which is based off of Devolution v7/Dodian Source.
PS - Did I put the case 930, wrong? I put it by the yes emote which is id 168. Am I supposed to put it something else? Declare a void or something?
btw - I have both sounds and sound effects enabled. I would like at least sounds (city music) to be muted if chosen. Both would be nice though.
Thanks!

item.title: Help With Muting
item.dc:creator: @expozee expozee
item.description:
@expozee wrote:

mute your computer sounds jks

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Muting
item.dc:creator: @_James_scape _James_scape
item.description:
@_James_scape wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:6, topic:408217”][quote author=_James_scape link=topic=509500.msg3696514#msg3696514 date=1312471459]

Just make another method that disabled the sounds, exactly like enabling but change some things.

Ok once I do that, How would I enable it via button? or command? If your not busy, could you help me with the muting part? would I change this:

/** * Sends the ID of the music to play via the client. * @param musicID The ID of the music to play. */ public void sendMusic(int musicID) { outStream.createFrame(74); outStream.writeWordBigEndian(musicID); }

would I change the above to mute the city music? Just make it a negative somehow and declare it somewhere in client.java?
[/quote]
No idea bro, try to play around with it, by counteracting it.[/quote]

Alright thanks for the help. At least I know what to do. Thanks! I appreciate it

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Muting
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote="_James_scape, post:5, topic:408217"][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=509500.msg3696508#msg3696508 date=1312471246]
Just make another method that disabled the sounds, exactly like enabling but change some things.
[/quote]

Ok once I do that, How would I enable it via button? or command? If your not busy, could you help me with the muting part? would I change this:

/** * Sends the ID of the music to play via the client. * @param musicID The ID of the music to play. */ public void sendMusic(int musicID) { outStream.createFrame(74); outStream.writeWordBigEndian(musicID); }

would I change the above to mute the city music? Just make it a negative somehow and declare it somewhere in client.java?[/quote]
No idea bro, try to play around with it, by counteracting it.

Read full topic

https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,439745.msg3231368.html#msg3231368
